comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Creighton_Carlin Charles Creighton Carlin (April 8, 1866 – October 14, 1938) was a U.S. representative from Virginia. bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=N000039 with photo, for NELSON, John Mandt, (1870 - 1955), would suggest that Bain has the other two individuals switched. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_M._Nelson GARD, Warren, a Representative from Ohio bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=G000048 and en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warren_Gard

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of March 7, 1916 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60C11F93B5B1773... indicates that they were on the House Committee on the Judiciary

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: LoC has another photo of this group, possibly during the same hearing, although not in the same exact location, in the National Photo Company collection. See www.loc.gov/pictures/item/npc2008012016/ which names them from L to R and agrees with me that Bain got two of the men switched. {Note to LoC: There's a probable typo in the NCP photo caption in Nelson's first name.} And archive.org/details/chargesagainsths00unit is a copy of the committee hearing digitized from LoC collections.
